name: DTM-ITP-007- Concrete - Kerb, Footpaths & Islands
template name: DTM-ITP-007- Concrete - Kerb, Footpaths & Islands Rev0

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
1.3 - Submission & Approval of Concrete Mix Design
FREQUENCY: Prior to first concrete pour

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall submit the concrete mix design details for review by the Superintendent not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete. Concrete shall not be placed until the mix design has been reviewed by the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Mix design approval

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings. The superintendent will review and confirm set out. The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work. No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavation completed to required depth to allow placement of the bedding layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Depth and type of bedding material varies, refer to IFC and LGAT drawings
○ Bedding shall be not less than 150 mm thick compacted for shared use paths
○ Bedding shall be not less than 100 mm compacted thickness for footpaths and other surfacings
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: 703.21 Drawings, LGAT standard drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall comply with the requirements of AS 3610
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforment used shall consist of SL72 mesh is to be placed with a minimum cover of 50mm from the top (unless shown otherwise on drawings).
○ Reinforcement must comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 4671
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Pre Pour Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling and testing of the strength of concrete shall be carried out in accordance with clause 6.2 of AS 1379.
○ The consistency of the concrete shall be determined by a slump test of each concrete strength sample in accordance with AS 1012.3 and clause 5.2 of AS 1379.
○ The temperature of concrete,measured immediately prior to placing, shall not be less than 10°C or greater than 32°C.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Pre Pour Checklist

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be thoroughly compaction via contious tamping and internal vibration. Where concrete is unformed it shall be hand tamped to a smooth surface and screeded in accordance with the construction drawings.
○ Where fresh concrete is being placed against concrete which has taken initial set a properly formed construction joint must be used.
– N25 for footpath, mowing strip, pram ramps
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Pre Pour Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Batch location recorded on Load Batch Traceability Checklist
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Load batch tracebility checklist

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete elements shall have a Class 3 surface finish (Good visual quality when viewed as a whole) for external surfaces and a Class 4 surface finish (Texture not important. Good general alignment) for permanently hidden surfaces in accordance with AS 3610.
○ Footpaths and other Surfacing shall be compelted with a wooden float.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that pram crossings are constructed in accordance with requirements for access and mobility.
○ Type A and B pram crossings to be constructed as per LGAT Drawings TSD-R18
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, LGAT TSD-R18
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Driveways to be constructed as per Accommodation Works Drawings and LGAT Drawings TSD-R09
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, LGAT TSD-R09, Accommodation Works Drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Expansion joints shall be installated at 18.3m regular intervals using 10mm compressible joint filler. Connolly joints at 6.1m regular intervals.
○ Prevent bonding between edging and surfacing. Either paint back of edging with bitumen or use a strip of bituminous felt material.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete shall be protected from damage from early loading by pedestrians, animals, vehicles and from rain or any other cause.
○ No crossing until a minimum of 4 days from casting of concrete.
○ Vehicles equal to or less than 1.5 tonnes in weight may be permitted to cross after 4 days, vehicles greater than 1.5 tonnes may be permitted to cross after 7 days.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be cured immediately either by water curing, wet hessian, polyethylene sheeting which is adequately sealed, curing compound or a combination of these.
○ Curing compounds shall comply with AS 3799. The curing compound shall be applied in two coats using a fine spray at the rate stated on the certificate of compliance
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Post Pour Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where matching in with existing surface levels, the new surface shall be within ± 5mm existing.
Section dimensions shall be constructed within the following tolerances:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After curing, no earlier than 3 days, backfilling shall be completed as per the below:
○ Width ≥ 300mm behind edging to top of edging
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The minimum compressive strength requirements for each concrete grade shall be as shown in Table 703.111.
○ Compressive strength testing shall not be required for concrete used in extruded kerbs.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Test records
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
